Coinage''' within the nation of [[Thay]] was rarely minted,{{Cite archive/Greenwood's Grotto/2023-10-31/Currency of Thay}} as by the 15{{th}} century [[DR]] they used the [[coinage]] of other realms as much as possible.

The standard Thayan-minted coins were flat plagues, {{SI|2|in|long=yes}} tall, in the shape of an inverted simple keystone ("tall" trapezoids with the small end at the top). They bore the symbol of [[Thaymount]] on both sides, in opposite vertical orientations, with a hole pierced in their center to allow for stringing multiple coins together on a ring. Each was made of the metal or alloy that they represented – [[copper]], [[silver]], [[electrum]], [[gold]], and [[platinum]].

In the realms outside of Thay, many shunned Thayan coinage out of a common fear that the coins would be [[magic]]ally [[curse]]d. In the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], Thayan coins were occasionally found in use in the nation of [[Tethyr]], though only be the most experienced and traveled of merchants.<ref>
